result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Bryan J Gleisner was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Mukwonago Police Department.  Bail applied to costs/surcharge. Paid in full.

Huber with standard release conditions to commence FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 2 days were granted.  Defendant to serve the first 75 days in Huber, balance of sentence may be served on electronic monitoring.  Sentence maybe transferred to the Walworth County Jail.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Bryan J Gleisner in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed by operation of law.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements. S.P. makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #2.  
220 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 2 days).  Defendant to serve the first 75 days in huber, remainder of the 220 days may be served on electronic monitoring.  Sentence commences immediately. Sentence maybe transferred to the Walworth County Jail.  
FINE:  $2252.00 Bail to be applied
DNA Surcharge: $200.00  Bail to be applied
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Mukwonago Police Department.  Bail to be applied.  
Remainder of the bail to be refunded to the poster. 
DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.
